archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Combat Letters from Union Soldier, dated December 12, 1861
did.abstract: Two letters from a Union Soldier, signed as "Mac". One letter written from Camp Hooker detailing the end of a Rebel blockade after the shelling of a Rebel battery by a Union gunboat, dated 12/12/1861. Other letter is incomplete and provides detailed description of an unknown combat operation, n.d.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Combat Letters from Union Soldier, Special Collections Research Center, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 09/01/2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two letters from a Union Soldier, signed as "Mac". One letter written from Camp Hooker detailing the end of a Rebel blockade after the shelling of a Rebel battery by a Union gunboat, dated 12/12/1861. Other letter is incomplete and provides detailed description of an unknown combat operation, n.d.
